content.en: Chemoinformatics with SVM: Support vector machines (SVM) are powerful algorithms that have been used in various areas of drug discovery and chemoinformatics. They have shown superior performance in tasks such as classifying compound classes, predicting drug-likeness and enzyme inhibition, and screening molecules for specific properties. SVMs have also been used in combination with other techniques, such as feature selection and multiple kernel learning, to further enhance their effectiveness. Overall, SVMs have become a popular and state-of-the-art approach in the field of chemoinformatics for compound classification and property predictions.
content.da: Kemoinformatik med SVM: Supportvektormaskiner (SVM) er kraftfulde algoritmer, der er blevet brugt inden for forskellige områder af lægemiddeldesign og kemoinformatik. De har vist overlegen ydeevne i opgaver som at klassificere forbindelsesklasser, forudsige lægemiddel-lighed og enzymhæmning samt screene molekyler for specifikke egenskaber. SVM'er er også blevet brugt i kombination med andre teknikker, såsom egenskabsudvælgelse og multiple kernellæring, for yderligere at forbedre deres effektivitet. Samlet set er SVM'er blevet en populær og topmoderne tilgang inden for kemoinformatik til klassificering af forbindelser og forudsigelse af egenskaber.
